original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought this:

original: ma la bdag gis rnam par bsam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la bdag gis rnam par bsam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “Now I will enter into the samādhi of the contemplation of the skeleton.”

original: de lhag par rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par brtsams te /
analyzed: de lhag par rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par brtsams te /
translated: He began to enter into the samādhi of the contemplation of the skeleton.

original: des rnam par bsam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na zhal dang / @60b shangs nas dbugs rdub pa dang / 'byung ba ba gags so //
analyzed: des rnam par bsam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na zhal dang / @60b shangs nas dbugs rdub pa dang / 'byung ba ba gags so //
translated: When he entered into the samādhi of the contemplation of the skeleton, the in- and out-breaths through his mouth and nose were blocked.

original: de'i zhal dang / shangs nas dbugs rdub pa dang / 'byung ba bgags pa de'i tshe sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes so; ;dper na /
analyzed: de'i zhal dang / shangs nas dbugs rdub pa dang / 'byung ba bgags pa de'i tshe sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes so; ;dper na /
translated: When the in- and out-breaths through his mouth and nose were blocked, a very unbearable heat arose in his body.

original: mi shin tu stobs dang ldan pa gnyis kyis mi stobs shin tu chung ba zhig phyin log du bzung ste me dong gi nang du dpyangs na /
analyzed: mi shin tu stobs dang ldan pa gnyis kyis mi stobs shin tu chung ba zhig phyin log du bzung ste me dong gi nang du dpyangs na /
translated: For example, it is like when two very strong men grab a very weak man by his arms and hang him upside down in a pit of fire.

original: de'i lus la lus kyi gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skye ba de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes kyang de zhum pa
analyzed: de'i lus la lus kyi gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skye ba de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes kyang de zhum pa
translated: Just as the body of the man who is afflicted by the most terrible physical pain, so the body of the Bodhisattva who is absorbed in the meditation on the bloated is afflicted by the most terrible pain.

original: ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin gyi /
translated: But he is not discouraged.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He is energetic, and so on as before.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought:

original: ma la bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad du zas mi bza' ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad du zas mi bza' ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “Now I will practice not eating anything at all.”

original: de nas lha rab tu mang po'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i thugs shes nas byang chub sems dpa' gang na bder dong ste phyin nas byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rab tu mang po'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i thugs shes nas byang chub sems dpa' gang na bder dong ste phyin nas byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then many gods, knowing the Bodhisattva’s thoughts with their own minds, went to the Bodhisattva and said to him:

original: grogs po / gal te khyod mi'i kha zas kyis 'dzem par mdzad /
analyzed: grogs po / gal te khyod mi'i kha zas kyis 'dzem par mdzad /
translated: “Friend, if you are disgusted with human food,

original: ngo tsha bar mdzad /
analyzed: ngo tsha bar mdzad /
translated: You should be ashamed of yourselves!

original: smon par mdzad na /
analyzed: smon par mdzad na /
translated: If you want to make a wish,

original: bdag cag gis khyod kyi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas lha'i mdangs bsgrub par bgyi'i khyod kyis bdag gir mdzod cig /
analyzed: bdag cag gis khyod kyi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas lha'i mdangs bsgrub par bgyi'i khyod kyis bdag gir mdzod cig /
translated: then we will restore your divine radiance in all your pores, so you should accept it!”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought,

original: @61a *// gal te bdag gis mi'i kha zas mi bza' bar dam bcas la bdag gi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad du lha rnams kyis lha'i mdangs bsgrubs nas da bdag gir byed pa ni bdag gi rdzun yin la /
analyzed: @61a *// gal te bdag gis mi'i kha zas mi bza' bar dam bcas la bdag gi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad du lha rnams kyis lha'i mdangs bsgrubs nas da bdag gir byed pa ni bdag gi rdzun yin la /
translated: “If I have vowed not to eat human food, and the gods restore my divine radiance in all my pores, and I accept it now, that would be a lie on my part.

original: bdag gi rdzun gang yin pa de ni bdag gi log pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi rdzun gang yin pa de ni bdag gi log pa yin no //
translated: And whatever is a lie on my part is a falsehood on my part.

original: bdag gi log pa gang yin pa de'i rkyen gyis na 'di na sems can kha cig lus zhig ste shi nas ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi log pa gang yin pa de'i rkyen gyis na 'di na sems can kha cig lus zhig ste shi nas ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: And because of that falsehood, some beings here, when their bodies break up and they die, fall into the lower realms, the bad rebirths, and are born in the hells.🔽So I will completely abandon the words of the gods,

original: mal bdag gis lha rnams kyi tshig ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs la /
analyzed: mal bdag gis lha rnams kyi tshig ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs la /
translated: and

original: kha zas nyung ba dang / cung zad chang chung bza' ba'am /🔽yang na mon sran sde'u yi khu ba'am /
analyzed: kha zas nyung ba dang / cung zad chang chung bza' ba'am / yang na mon sran sde'u yi khu ba'am /
translated: He will eat little, very little, a little, or just a little.🔽Or he will drink a soup of mung beans,

original: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu ba'am /
translated: or a soup of chickpeas,

original: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba btung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba btung ngo snyam mo //
translated: or a soup of harītakī fruits.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe lha rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs nas zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba'am /🔽yang na mon sran sde'u yi khu ba'am /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe lha rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs nas zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba'am / yang na mon sran sde'u yi khu ba'am /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, having completely rejected the words of the gods, ate little, very little, a little, or just a little.🔽Or he drank a soup of mung beans,

original: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu ba'am /
translated: or a soup of chickpeas,

original: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba gsol lo //
analyzed: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba gsol lo //
translated: or a soup of harītakī fruits.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /🔽yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kun tu zhum ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na / yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kun tu zhum ste /
translated: Then, as the Bodhisattva ate little, very little, a little, or just a little,🔽all his major and minor body parts became emaciated.

original: skam zhing @61b sku dbal chung bar gyur to //
analyzed: skam zhing @61b sku dbal chung bar gyur to //
translated: He became thin and weak.

original: dper na / ldum bu ai si ta'i sdong bu dang / ka li ka'i sdong bu 'jum /
analyzed: dper na / ldum bu ai si ta'i sdong bu dang / ka li ka'i sdong bu 'jum /
translated: the stems of the isīka grass and the stems of the kalika grass are bent,🔽and completely bent, and so the grass is small and dried up.

original: kun tu 'jum pas sha chung zhing bskams par gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: kun tu 'jum pas sha chung zhing bskams par gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: In the same way, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small portions, a little, and very little,

original: yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad zhum /
analyzed: yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad zhum /
translated: all his major and minor body parts became flaccid,

original: kun tu zhum ste /
analyzed: kun tu zhum ste /
translated: and completely flaccid.

original: skem zhing sku dbal chung bar gyur to //
analyzed: skem zhing sku dbal chung bar gyur to //
translated: He became emaciated and his body became very thin.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dag chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dag chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: Then, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small portions, a little, and very little,

original: dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyings /
analyzed: dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyings /
translated: his head skin became old on his head,

original: kun tu rnyings te /
analyzed: kun tu rnyings te /
translated: and completely old.

original: 'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur to //
analyzed: 'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur to //
translated: It became wrinkled and bumpy.🔽For example,

original: dper na / ku ba rtsa ba nas bcad na rnyis /
analyzed: dper na / ku ba rtsa ba nas bcad na rnyis /
translated: when a pumpkin is cut from the root, it becomes old,🔽and completely old.

original: kun tu rnyis pas 'khums la 'bar 'bur du gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang; chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: kun tu rnyis pas 'khums la 'bar 'bur du gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang; chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: Just as the skin of his head became wrinkled, shriveled, and wrinkled all over, in the same way, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small portions, a little, and a small amount,

original: dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyis /🔽kun tu rnyes te /
analyzed: dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyis / kun tu rnyes te /
translated: the skin of his head became wrinkled,🔽shriveled, and wrinkled all over.

original: 'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur kyang de zhum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur kyang de zhum pa ma yin te /
translated: But he was not discouraged,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and so on as before.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought this:

original: zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: “When I eat little food, small portions, a little, and a small amount,

original: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song zhing shin tu phug tu song ste zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song zhing shin tu phug tu song ste zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang ngo //
translated: the pupils of my two eyes recede, recede completely, and appear as if they have been pulled out, very deeply, extremely deeply, and far away.

original: dper na / khron @62a *//
analyzed: dper na / khron @62a *//
translated: For example,

original: pa zab mo'i chur skar ma'i gzugs brnyan phug tu song zhing shin tu phug tu song ste /
analyzed: pa zab mo'i chur skar ma'i gzugs brnyan phug tu song zhing shin tu phug tu song ste /
translated: Just as the reflection of a form in the water of a deep well is very deep and extremely deep,

original: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bar gtam du bya ba de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bar gtam du bya ba de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: and is said to be very deep and extremely deep because it is far away, in the same way, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small food, a little food, and very little food,

original: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song /
analyzed: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song /
translated: the pupils of his two eyes were very deep,

original: shin tu phug tu song ste /
analyzed: shin tu phug tu song ste /
translated: and extremely deep.

original: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang yang de zhum pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang yang de zhum pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Although they appeared to be far away because they were very deep and extremely deep, he was not depressed.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He was one who exerted effort.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: Then, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small food, a little food, and very little food,

original: de'i tshe rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur te /
translated: at that time the spaces between his ribs became deep.

original: dper na / rtsva khang lo gnyis sam /
analyzed: dper na / rtsva khang lo gnyis sam /
translated: For example, it was like the space between the walls of a two-year-old

original: gsum lon pa'i phyam dgu po mtho dman du gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: gsum lon pa'i phyam dgu po mtho dman du gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang / cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: Just as the nine flat bones of the pelvis become uneven, in the same way, when the Bodhisattva eats little food, small morsels, small portions, and small bites,🔽the spaces between his ribs become uneven.

original: rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur kyang de zhum pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur kyang de zhum pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But he is not discouraged.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He is one who has begun to strive.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang; cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na /🔽sgal pa'i tshigs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang / chung ba dang; cung zad dang / chang chung gsol ba na / sgal pa'i tshigs 'di lta ste /
translated: Then, when the Bodhisattva eats little food, small morsels, small portions, and small bites,

original: skra'i lan bu lta bur gyur to //🔽mjug do ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: skra'i lan bu lta bur gyur to // mjug do ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: his spine becomes like a braided horse’s tail.

original: rnga mo'i rkang pa lta bur @62b gyur to //🔽de lan 'ga' ldang bar 'dod na kha sbub tu 'gyel la /
analyzed: rnga mo'i rkang pa lta bur @62b gyur to // de lan 'ga' ldang bar 'dod na kha sbub tu 'gyel la /
translated: His buttocks become like a camel’s hoof.🔽When he wants to get up, he falls forward.

original: lan 'ga' 'dug par 'dod na gan rkyal du 'gyel lo //
analyzed: lan 'ga' 'dug par 'dod na gan rkyal du 'gyel lo //
translated: When he wants to sit down, he falls backward.

original: de ro stod la brten nas ro smad 'jog par byed /
analyzed: de ro stod la brten nas ro smad 'jog par byed /
translated: He supports his upper body with his hands and then sets down his lower body.

original: ro smad la brten nas ro stod 'jog par byed do //🔽de phyag gnyis kyis sku la byugs te /
analyzed: ro smad la brten nas ro stod 'jog par byed do // de phyag gnyis kyis sku la byugs te /
translated: He would support his upper body on his lower body.🔽He would anoint his body with his two hands.

original: de'i phyag gnyis kyis sku la byugs /
analyzed: de'i phyag gnyis kyis sku la byugs /
translated: He would anoint his body with his two hands.

original: yongs su byugs pa de'i tshe ba spu rnams drung rul bas sa la lhags par gyur to //
analyzed: yongs su byugs pa de'i tshe ba spu rnams drung rul bas sa la lhags par gyur to //
translated: When he was completely anointed, his hair fell out and fell to the ground.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought this:

original: ma la / bdag gis til 'bru gcig gis zas bza' bar bya'o zhes te des til 'bru gcig gi zas gsol to //
analyzed: ma la / bdag gis til 'bru gcig gis zas bza' bar bya'o zhes te des til 'bru gcig gi zas gsol to //
translated: “Well now, I will eat one sesame seed.” He ate one sesame seed.

original: de til 'bru gcig gi zas gsol ba na yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad zhum kun du zhum ste skem zhing sku dbal chung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de til 'bru gcig gi zas gsol ba na yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad zhum kun du zhum ste skem zhing sku dbal chung bar gyur to //
translated: When he ate one sesame seed, all his major and minor body parts became emaciated, withered, and weak.

original: til 'bru gcig gis ji lta bar 'bras bu gcig dang / sran go la 'bru gcig dang / rgya sran 'bru gcig dang / mon sran gre'u 'bru gcig dang / mon sran sde'u 'bru gcig dang / rtsa'i gding ba la mnal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: til 'bru gcig gis ji lta bar 'bras bu gcig dang / sran go la 'bru gcig dang / rgya sran 'bru gcig dang / mon sran gre'u 'bru gcig dang / mon sran sde'u 'bru gcig dang / rtsa'i gding ba la mnal bar mdzad do //
translated: Just as with one sesame seed, he ate one grain of rice, one green gram, one bean, one lentil, and one pea. He lay down on a bed of straw.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis dka' ba la spyod pa'i gnas skabs de thos nas nyi ma re re zhing rtog pa nyis brgya lnga bcu gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis dka' ba la spyod pa'i gnas skabs de thos nas nyi ma re re zhing rtog pa nyis brgya lnga bcu gtong bar byed do //
translated: King Śuddhodana, hearing of the Bodhisattva’s austerities, sent two hundred and fifty spies every day.

original: rgyal po legs par rab sad kyis @63a *//
analyzed: rgyal po legs par rab sad kyis @63a *//
translated: King Prasenajit

original: kyang nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: kyang nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: also sent two hundred and fifty.

original: de dag nyi ma re re zhing de gnyis la myur ba myur bar gtam skyel bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag nyi ma re re zhing de gnyis la myur ba myur bar gtam skyel bar byed do //
translated: They would report to the two kings every day.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di 'dra ba'i dka' ba spyod de //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di 'dra ba'i dka' ba spyod de //
translated: “The Bodhisattva is practicing austerities like this.

original: til 'bru gcig dang / 'bras 'bru gcig dang / sran gol 'bru gcig dang / rgya sran 'bru gcig dang / mon sren gre'u 'bru gcig dang / mon sran sde'u 'bru gcig gi zas gsol zhing rtsva'i gding ba la mnal to zhes smra'o //
analyzed: til 'bru gcig dang / 'bras 'bru gcig dang / sran gol 'bru gcig dang / rgya sran 'bru gcig dang / mon sren gre'u 'bru gcig dang / mon sran sde'u 'bru gcig gi zas gsol zhing rtsva'i gding ba la mnal to zhes smra'o //
translated: He eats one sesame seed, one rice grain, one kidney bean, one pea, one lentil, and one chickpea, and he sleeps on a straw mat.”

original: de rgyal po zas gtsang gis thos nas bu'i mya ngan gyis non pas lhag par dang kan zhing mig mchims pa rnams te gdungs nas btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas par rtsva'i gding ba la nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: de rgyal po zas gtsang gis thos nas bu'i mya ngan gyis non pas lhag par dang kan zhing mig mchims pa rnams te gdungs nas btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas par rtsva'i gding ba la nyal bar byed do //
translated: King Śuddhodana, hearing this, was overcome with grief for his son. His eyes filled with tears of anguish, and he lay down on a straw mat, together with his harem.

original: grags 'dzin mas kyang de thos pa dang / khyim thab kyi mya ngan gyis mnon to //
analyzed: grags 'dzin mas kyang de thos pa dang / khyim thab kyi mya ngan gyis mnon to //
translated: Yaśodharā, hearing this, was also overcome with grief for her husband.

analyzed: til 'bru gcig za ba dang; de'i rum mi bde ba de nyid du zhu bar gyur to //

analyzed: skye ba gcig dang / gnyis dang; gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / skye ba brgya dang /

analyzed: skye ba stong dang / skye ba brgya stong dang / skye ba brgya phrag du ma dang / skye ba stong phrag du ma dang / skye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa dang /

analyzed: chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jigs pa'i bskal pa du am dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma rjes @74b su dgongs te / bdag sngon sems can 'di dag gi nang na gnas pa na ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: many eons of destruction, many eons of formation, and many eons of destruction and formation.

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: “I was born in this place, in this family, in this class, with this name, this caste, this food, this experience of pleasure and pain, and this lifespan.🔽I lived for so long, and then I passed away from there and was born somewhere else.🔽I lived for so long, and then I passed away from there and was born here.”

original: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong /
translated: I experienced such and such happiness and suffering.

original: tshe ni 'di srid cig lon /
analyzed: tshe ni 'di srid cig lon /
translated: I lived for so long.

original: yun ni 'di srid cig 'dug 'dug /🔽tshe 'di srid cig lon te gnas de nas bdag shi 'phos te che ge mo zhig du skyes so //
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid cig 'dug 'dug / tshe 'di srid cig lon te gnas de nas bdag shi 'phos te che ge mo zhig du skyes so //
translated: I stayed for so long.🔽After so long, I died and was reborn in such and such a place.

original: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: After that, I died and was reborn in such and such a place.

original: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes rnam par dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes rnam par dang bcas pa /
translated: After that, I died and was reborn here.

original: yul phyogs dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dgongs so //
analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dgongs so //
translated: In this way, he recollects his various past abodes with their aspects and locations.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te /🔽bdud kyi mngag gzhug 'di rnams las su dag ni ngan song du 'gro /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te / bdud kyi mngag gzhug 'di rnams las su dag ni ngan song du 'gro /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought,

original: su dag ni ngan song du mi 'gro ba de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: su dag ni ngan song du mi 'gro ba de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
translated: “From among these servants of Mara, who will go to the lower realms and who will not? How can I know this?”🔽Then the Bodhisattva thought,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought this:🔽

original: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pas yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pas yin no snyam ste /
translated: I will know their deaths and rebirths through the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of death and rebirth.”

original: de nam gyi thun tha mal 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na de'i lha'i spyan rnam par dag pa mi rnams kyi las 'das pas gzigs na sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang /🔽skye ba dang / kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / bde 'gro dang / nga @75a *//🔽'gror 'gro ba'i sems can rnams la ji lta ba bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba /
analyzed: de nam gyi thun tha mal 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na de'i lha'i spyan rnam par dag pa mi rnams kyi las 'das pas gzigs na sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / bde 'gro dang / nga @75a *// 'gror 'gro ba'i sems can rnams la ji lta ba bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba /
translated: When he focused his mind on the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of death and rebirth in the last watch of the night, he saw with his divine eye, which is purified and surpasses that of humans, that beings die and are reborn, that they go to good or bad rebirths according to their deeds.🔽He saw that beings are just as they are—good or bad, beautiful or ugly, excellent or not excellent—and that they go to good or bad rebirths according to their deeds.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He saw that beings are just as they are—good or bad, beautiful or ugly, excellent or not excellent—and that they go to good or bad rebirths according to their deeds.

original: shes ldan dag /
analyzed: shes ldan dag /
translated: “Sirs,

original: sems can 'di zhes bya ba 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: sems can 'di zhes bya ba 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: these beings, who are called such-and-such, have engaged in misconduct with the body,

original: ngag gi dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / ldan te /
analyzed: ngag gi dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / ldan te /
translated: have engaged in misconduct with speech, and have engaged in misconduct with the mind.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa log par lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa log par lta ba ste /
translated: They slander the noble ones and have wrong views.

original: log par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de rnams dang / rkyen des lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de rnams dang / rkyen des lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the causes and conditions of adopting the Dharma and actions of wrong views, when their bodies disintegrate, after death, they fall into bad transmigrations and are born among the hells.

original: shes ldan dag /
analyzed: shes ldan dag /
translated: “Sirs,

original: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: these sentient beings have good physical conduct,

original: ngag gi dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: ngag gi dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan te /
translated: good verbal conduct, and good mental conduct.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs shing yang dag par lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs shing yang dag par lta ba ste /
translated: They do not slander the noble ones and have right views.

original: yang dag par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams su skye par 'gyur ro zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams su skye par 'gyur ro zhes rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Because of the causes and conditions of adopting the Dharma and actions of right views, when their bodies disintegrate, after death, they are born in good transmigrations and are born among gods and humans.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te rtag tu bya ba dang / 'grus skyong dang ldan zhing byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su mthun pas bzhugs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te rtag tu bya ba dang / 'grus skyong dang ldan zhing byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su mthun pas bzhugs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, dwelling in the vicinity of the Bodhi tree, always engaged in action, endowed with perseverance, in accord with the yoga of cultivating the dharmas that are the factors of awakening,

original: de nam gyi thun tha ma la zag pa zad pa'i shes @75b pa mngon sum du bya ba'i shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
analyzed: de nam gyi thun tha ma la zag pa zad pa'i shes @75b pa mngon sum du bya ba'i shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
translated: in the last watch of the night, when he had actualized the knowledge that is the direct perception of the exhaustion of the defilements,

original: des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: he knew just as it is: “This is the noble truth of suffering.”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When he knew and saw in this way, his mind was liberated from the defilement of desire,

original: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is liberated from the defilement of existence and the defilement of ignorance.

original: rnam par grol na bdag gis skye ba ni zad do //
analyzed: rnam par grol na bdag gis skye ba ni zad do //
translated: When liberated, he thinks, “My births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la bsten to //
translated: I have lived the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //🔽'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes de nyid du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes thugs su chud par gyur cing de ltar bcom ldan 'das nam gyi thun tha ma la bdud 'byung
analyzed: bya ba byas so // 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes de nyid du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes thugs su chud par gyur cing de ltar bcom ldan 'das nam gyi thun tha ma la bdud 'byung
translated: I have done what needed to be done.🔽I will know no other existence than this.”🔽In this way, he realizes unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang bcas pa las byams pa'i mtshon gyis mngon par rgyal te bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes so //
analyzed: po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang bcas pa las byams pa'i mtshon gyis mngon par rgyal te bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes so //
translated: In this way, the Blessed One, in the last watch of the night, with the weapon of love, conquered the thirty-six million māras and attained unsurpassed wisdom.

original: de nas bdud sdig can gyi lag pa nas gzhu shor ba dang / rgyal mtshan rtse mo thur du lta ba dang / gnas g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can gyi lag pa nas gzhu shor ba dang / rgyal mtshan rtse mo thur du lta ba dang / gnas g-yos par gyur to //
translated: Then, the bow slipped from the hands of Māra the evil one, his victory banner fell over, and his abode shook.

original: de nas bdud sdig can 'byung po'i 'khor bye ba phrag gsum cu rtsa drug dang bcas par sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la yid la bcags te de nyid du mi snang @76a *//🔽bar gyur nas rang gi gnas su song ste /
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can 'byung po'i 'khor bye ba phrag gsum cu rtsa drug dang bcas par sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la yid la bcags te de nyid du mi snang @76a *// bar gyur nas rang gi gnas su song ste /
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, together with his retinue of thirty-six million bhūtas, was miserable, unhappy, and dejected. He disappeared right there and then and returned to his own abode.🔽Miserable, unhappy, and defeated, he sat down and began to think, scratching the ground with his foot.

original: sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la pham par gyur pas sems pa la zhugs te mdas sa la 'dre zhing gnas par gyur to; ;de nas bdud kyi bu mo sred ma dang / dga' byed ma dang / dga' spyod ma zhes bya ba bdud gang na ba der song ste phyin nas bdud sdig can la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la pham par gyur pas sems pa la zhugs te mdas sa la 'dre zhing gnas par gyur to; ;de nas bdud kyi bu mo sred ma dang / dga' byed ma dang / dga' spyod ma zhes bya ba bdud gang na ba der song ste phyin nas bdud sdig can la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Māra’s daughters Craving, Delight, and Enjoyment went to where Māra, the evil one, was and said to him:

original: yab khyod ci phyir thugs mi dgyes //
analyzed: yab khyod ci phyir thugs mi dgyes //
translated: “Father, why are you unhappy?

original: ci yi phyir na 'di ltar bzhugs //🔽gang gis khyod la gnod byed pa'i //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na 'di ltar bzhugs // gang gis khyod la gnod byed pa'i //
translated: Why do you sit here like this?🔽What person who has harmed you

original: skyes bu gang la rjes su sems //🔽gsungs shig de ni 'dod chags kyi //
analyzed: skyes bu gang la rjes su sems // gsungs shig de ni 'dod chags kyi //
translated: are you thinking of?🔽Tell us, and we will bring him

original: zhags pas nags nas glang po bzhin //
analyzed: zhags pas nags nas glang po bzhin //
translated: with the noose of desire, like an elephant from the forest.”

original: bcings nas bdag cag 'tshal te mchi //
analyzed: bcings nas bdag cag 'tshal te mchi //
translated: We are bound and will go to him.

original: de ni khyod kyi dbang du gyur //
analyzed: de ni khyod kyi dbang du gyur //
translated: He is now under your power.

original: bdud kyis smras pa /
analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa /
translated: Māra said:

original: skyes bu 'dod chags rab bral te //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dod chags rab bral te //
translated: “This man is completely free from desire.

original: chags pas legs par dgug mi nus //
analyzed: chags pas legs par dgug mi nus //
translated: He cannot be seduced by passion.

original: bdud kyi yul 'das de yi phyir //
analyzed: bdud kyi yul 'das de yi phyir //
translated: Since he has gone beyond the realm of Māra,

original: nga ni shin tu mya ngan byed //
analyzed: nga ni shin tu mya ngan byed //
translated: I am utterly miserable.”

original: de nas sred ma dang / dga' byed ma dang / dga' spyod ma ste /
analyzed: de nas sred ma dang / dga' byed ma dang / dga' spyod ma ste /
translated: Then three of Māra’s daughters, namely, Trṣṇā, Rati, and Arati,

original: bdud kyi bu mo gsum po sprin las byung ba'i glog bzhin du gzi brjid rab tu 'bar zhing rang gi gnas nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der logs su song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bdud kyi bu mo gsum po sprin las byung ba'i glog bzhin du gzi brjid rab tu 'bar zhing rang gi gnas nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der logs su song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: who were shining brightly like lightning flashes in the clouds, left their abode and went to where the Blessed One was. When they arrived, they bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la bdud sdig can gyi bu mo gsum gyis 'di skad @76b ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la bdud sdig can gyi bu mo gsum gyis 'di skad @76b ces gsol to //
translated: While they were sitting to one side, the three daughters of the evil Māra said to the Blessed One:

original: kye dge sbyong khyod kyi zhabs la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing bde bar gshegs pa khyod kyi ri ma gro bgyid do //
analyzed: kye dge sbyong khyod kyi zhabs la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing bde bar gshegs pa khyod kyi ri ma gro bgyid do //
translated: “O ascetic, we will serve at your feet and attend to you, O Sugata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ci nas kyang sred pa yang dag par zad cing rnam par grol la thugs yang dag par shin tu rnam par grol ba bla na med pa brnyes pas de la dgongs par ma mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci nas kyang sred pa yang dag par zad cing rnam par grol la thugs yang dag par shin tu rnam par grol ba bla na med pa brnyes pas de la dgongs par ma mdzad do //
translated: But the Blessed One, having completely exhausted craving, being liberated, and having attained the unsurpassed, complete, and perfect enlightenment, paid no heed to them.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du'ang bcom ldan 'das la bdud kyi bu mo gsum gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du'ang bcom ldan 'das la bdud kyi bu mo gsum gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: And a second time, and a third time, the three daughters of Māra said to the Blessed One,

original: kye dge sbyong khyod kyi zhabs la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing bde bar gshegs pa khyod kyi rim gro bgyid do //
analyzed: kye dge sbyong khyod kyi zhabs la bsnyen bkur bgyid cing bde bar gshegs pa khyod kyi rim gro bgyid do //
translated: “O ascetic, we will serve at your feet and attend to you, O Sugata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du'ang ci nas kyang sred pa yang dag par zad cing rnam par grol la thugs yang dag par shin tu rnam par grol ba bla na med pa brnyes pas de la dgongs par ma mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gnyis lan gsum du'ang ci nas kyang sred pa yang dag par zad cing rnam par grol la thugs yang dag par shin tu rnam par grol ba bla na med pa brnyes pas de la dgongs par ma mdzad do //
translated: But the Blessed One, having completely exhausted craving, being liberated, and having attained the unsurpassed, complete, and perfect enlightenment, paid no heed to them.

original: de nas bdud kyi bu mo gsum phyogs gcig tu song ste phan tshun smra zhing kun tu bgros pa /
analyzed: de nas bdud kyi bu mo gsum phyogs gcig tu song ste phan tshun smra zhing kun tu bgros pa /
translated: Then the three daughters of Māra went to one side and conversed with each other.

original: shes ldan spun zla dag /
analyzed: shes ldan spun zla dag /
translated: “Sirs, brothers,

original: skyes pa rnams kyis bud med la sred pa ni tha dad pa yin pas /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyis bud med la sred pa ni tha dad pa yin pas /
translated: men’s desire for women is different.

original: ma la bdag cag gis gzhon nu ma mdog mdangs brgya phrag dang / gos dang / kha dog brgya phrag dang bcas par mngon par sprul zhing bu btsas ma myong ba dang / lan gcig btsas pa dang / lan gnyis dang / gsum dang / lan bzhi btsas par mngon par sprul zhing bud med par ma'i tshul brgya phrag tu bdag nyid mngon par sprul la @77a *//
analyzed: ma la bdag cag gis gzhon nu ma mdog mdangs brgya phrag dang / gos dang / kha dog brgya phrag dang bcas par mngon par sprul zhing bu btsas ma myong ba dang / lan gcig btsas pa dang / lan gnyis dang / gsum dang / lan bzhi btsas par mngon par sprul zhing bud med par ma'i tshul brgya phrag tu bdag nyid mngon par sprul la @77a *//
translated: So let us now manifest hundreds of young women, with hundreds of garments and colors, some of whom have not yet given birth, some who have given birth once, some who have given birth twice, some who have given birth three times, and some who have given birth four times, and let us manifest ourselves in the guise of mothers of hundreds of children.

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma gang na ba der nye bar 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma gang na ba der nye bar 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Let us go to the śramaṇa Gautama.”

original: phyin nas kyang dge spyong goo ta ma la 'di skad ces dge sbyong khyod kyi zhabs la bsnyen bkur byed cing bde bar gshegs pa khyod la rim gro pa bgyid do //
analyzed: phyin nas kyang dge spyong goo ta ma la 'di skad ces dge sbyong khyod kyi zhabs la bsnyen bkur byed cing bde bar gshegs pa khyod la rim gro pa bgyid do //
translated: And when he arrived, he said to the monk Gautama, I will serve at your feet, O monk, and I will be your attendant, O Sugata.

original: zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: Having arrived, they will say to the ascetic Gautama, ‘Ascetic, we will serve at your feet. Sugata, we will be your attendants.’

original: de nas bdud kyi bu mo gsum po gzhon nu'i mdog brgya stong du mar bdag nyid mngon par sprul cing gos kha dog brgya phrag dang bcas pa nas ji srid du bud med par ma'i tshul brgya phrag tu bdag nyid mngon par sprul nas bcom ldan 'das ga

translated: Various flowers were scattered about, and in the four gates and the intersections of the city, houses for giving were built.

analyzed: de nas grong khyer gyi shar sgor dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / spyod pa pa dang; kun tu rgyu dang / ngan pa dang / mgon med pa dang / bkren pa dang / phongs pa dang / slong mo pa rnams la'ang sbyin pa dag gtong ngo // lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / dbus kyi @80a *//
translated: Then, at the eastern gate of the city, they gave gifts to ascetics, brahmins, practitioners, mendicants, the poor, the helpless, the destitute, the needy, and beggars.

original: sum mdo rnams su'ang sbyin pa dag gtong /
analyzed: sum mdo rnams su'ang sbyin pa dag gtong /
translated: They also gave gifts at the southern, western, and northern gates and in the center of the city.

original: bsod nams dag byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed do //
translated: He will do good actions and make merit.

original: grags 'dzin ma'i bu'i ming 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma'i bu'i ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: They gave a name to the son of Yaśodharā.

original: btsun mo'i 'khor gyi skye pos smras pa /
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor gyi skye pos smras pa /
translated: The people in the harem said,

original: 'di btsas pa na zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pas de bas na khye'u'i ming sgra gcan zin zhes gdags so zhes btags so //
analyzed: 'di btsas pa na zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pas de bas na khye'u'i ming sgra gcan zin zhes gdags so zhes btags so //
translated: “Since the moon was eclipsed when he was born, let us name the boy Rāhula.”

original: bdud rtsi zas kyi yang de bzhin du sbyin pa dag btang /
analyzed: bdud rtsi zas kyi yang de bzhin du sbyin pa dag btang /
translated: Similarly, the food of immortality was given,

original: bsod nams dag byas nas khye'u'i ming cir gdags zhes bu'i ming 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams dag byas nas khye'u'i ming cir gdags zhes bu'i ming 'dogs par byed do //
translated: and after making merit, they gave a name to the boy.

original: nye du dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: nye du dag gis smras pa /
translated: The relatives said,

original: gang gi tshe 'di btsas pa na grong khyer thams cad dga' bar gyur pas de'i phyir khye'u'i ming kun dga' bor gdags so zhes btags so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di btsas pa na grong khyer thams cad dga' bar gyur pas de'i phyir khye'u'i ming kun dga' bor gdags so zhes btags so //
translated: “Since the whole city rejoiced when he was born, let us name the boy Ānanda.”

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis smras pa /
translated: King Śuddhodana said,

original: grags 'dzin ma'i bu gang yin pa 'di ni sh'akya thub pa'i bu ma yin no zhes smras pa grags 'dzin mas thos nas yi chad par gyur to //
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma'i bu gang yin pa 'di ni sh'akya thub pa'i bu ma yin no zhes smras pa grags 'dzin mas thos nas yi chad par gyur to //
translated: “The son of Yaśodharā is not the son of Śākyamuni.” Yaśodharā heard this and became despondent.

original: de nas des byang chub sems dpa'i phang tshad kyi pha pong la bskyon nas rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du 'dug ste bden pa gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: de nas des byang chub sems dpa'i phang tshad kyi pha pong la bskyon nas rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du 'dug ste bden pa gsol ba btab pa /
translated: Then, having placed the Bodhisattva on the back of a bull, they went to the bank of the pleasure pond and prayed to the truth.

original: gal te 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin na de bzhin du rdzing 'dir pha pong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar gyur cig /
analyzed: gal te 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin na de bzhin du rdzing 'dir pha pong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar gyur cig /
translated: “If this is the son of the Bodhisattva, then let him float on the pond together with the stone.🔽If not, let him sink.”

original: ji ste ma yin na bying bar gyur cig ces smras nas chur por ba dang / de shing bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du pha bong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar gyur to //
analyzed: ji ste ma yin na bying bar gyur cig ces smras nas chur por ba dang / de shing bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du pha bong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar gyur to //
translated: Having said this, they threw him into the water, and he floated like a cotton ball together with the stone.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis ya mtshan du @80b gyur pa de thos nas skye bo'i tshogs chen pos yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis ya mtshan du @80b gyur pa de thos nas skye bo'i tshogs chen pos yongs su bskor te /
translated: When King Śuddhodana heard of this wonder, he went with a great crowd of people

original: byang chub sems dpa' rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du dong na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du dong na /
translated: to the bank of the pleasure pond where the Bodhisattva was.

original: ji tsam na sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po byang chub sems dpa'i phang tshad kyi ri bong la zhon nas shing bal gyi 'da' ba bzhin du chu na 'phyo ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam na sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po byang chub sems dpa'i phang tshad kyi ri bong la zhon nas shing bal gyi 'da' ba bzhin du chu na 'phyo ba mthong ngo //
translated: He saw the Bodhisattva Rāhulabhadra riding on the back of a rabbit, floating on the water like a cotton ball.

original: mthong nas kyang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa rgya chen po dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa rgya chen po dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: Seeing this, he was filled with joy, delight, and happiness.

original: de ma thag tu rdzing der zhugs nas gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po pang du blangs nas langs so //
analyzed: de ma thag tu rdzing der zhugs nas gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po pang du blangs nas langs so //
translated: He immediately entered the pond, took the young Rāhulabhadra onto his lap, and stood up.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug byams pa'i mtshon gyis mngon par btul nas bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa de'i tshes chen po 'di shin tu g-yos par gyur to //

translated: When the Blessed One, with the weapon of love, subdued the thirty-six million māras and their retinues and attained unsurpassed wisdom, this great earth shook violently.

Look, there are other beings here!”🔽“

original: de nas tshangs rris kyi lha gnyis shig tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na 'dug pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshangs rris kyi lha gnyis shig tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na 'dug pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then two Brahmakāyika gods, who were in the Brahma world, thought this:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na chu klung nee ranydza n'a'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na chu klung nee ranydza n'a'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te /
translated: “The Blessed Buddha is staying in the hot springs region, at the foot of a Bodhi tree on the banks of the Nairañjanā River.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs te skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'da' bar mdzad na de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul gyi /

translated: Not long after his full and complete awakening, he entered the fire element meditative stabilization and spent seven days in a single cross-legged posture, but no one has offered him alms.

original: ma la bdag cag der song la tshigs su bcad pa re res mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: ma la bdag cag der song la tshigs su bcad pa re res mngon par bstod do //
translated: Let us go there and praise him with a verse each.”

original: de nas tshangs ris kyi lha de gnyis kyis /
analyzed: de nas tshangs ris kyi lha de gnyis kyis /
translated: Then those two Brahmakāyika gods

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: said this:

original: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i dpung pa bskum ste brkyang ba'am /
analyzed: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i dpung pa bskum ste brkyang ba'am /
translated: “Just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm,

original: brkyangs ste bskum pa tsam gyis tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis kyis tshangs ris kyi 'jig rten nas mi snang bar gyur te; bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: brkyangs ste bskum pa tsam gyis tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis kyis tshangs ris kyi 'jig rten nas mi snang bar gyur te; bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste /
translated: In the time it takes to stretch out one’s arm and bring it back to one’s side, they disappeared from the Brahma realm and arrived in the presence of the Blessed One. They sat to one side and said to the Blessed One,

original: tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis las gcig gis tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis las gcig gis tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
translated: In the time it takes to stretch out one’s arm and draw it back, they disappeared from the Brahma realm and appeared before the Blessed One. They sat to one side and one of the Brahmakāyika gods spoke this verse:

original: ded dpon g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba phe //
analyzed: ded dpon g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba phe //
translated: “The caravan leader has won the battle and is victorious.

original: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs //
analyzed: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs //
translated: You who are without sin, arise and look upon the world.

original: rin chen chos ni 'tshal bar 'gyur mchis kyi //
analyzed: rin chen chos ni 'tshal bar 'gyur mchis kyi //
translated: The precious Dharma is to be found.

original: bde gshegs chos kyi mchog ni bshad du @81b gsol //
analyzed: bde gshegs chos kyi mchog ni bshad du @81b gsol //
translated: Sugata, please explain the supreme Dharma.”

original: gcig shos kyis kyang tshigs su bcad de gsol //
analyzed: gcig shos kyis kyang tshigs su bcad de gsol //
translated: The other also spoke this verse:

original: nga rgyal bcom zhing g-yul las rnam rgyal ba //
analyzed: nga rgyal bcom zhing g-yul las rnam rgyal ba //
translated: “You have conquered pride and won the battle.

original: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs //🔽bco lnga lon pa'i dgung zla nya ba ltar //
analyzed: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs // bco lnga lon pa'i dgung zla nya ba ltar //
translated: You who are without sin, arise and look upon the world.🔽Your mind is completely pure,

original: khyod kyi thugs ni shin tu rnam dag lags //
analyzed: khyod kyi thugs ni shin tu rnam dag lags //
translated: like the full moon of the fifteenth day.”

original: zhes gsol nas tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: zhes gsol nas tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Having said this, the two gods of the Brahmā group disappeared on the spot.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One rose from his absorption and at that time spoke in verse:🔽“Whatever happiness there is in the world,

original: 'jig rten 'dod pa'i bde gang dang // lha yul byung ba de gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dod pa'i bde gang dang // lha yul byung ba de gang yin pa //
translated: and whatever there is in the heavens,

original: sred pa zad pa'i bde de la //
analyzed: sred pa zad pa'i bde de la //
translated: the happiness of the end of craving🔽does not reach even a sixteenth part of it.

original: bcu drug char yang mi phod do; ;khur khyer ba ni sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: bcu drug char yang mi phod do; ;khur khyer ba ni sdug bsngal te //
translated: Carrying a load is suffering;

original: khur bor ba ni bde ba yin //
analyzed: khur bor ba ni bde ba yin //
translated: putting down the load is happiness.

original: khur ni lci ba rnam bor nas //
analyzed: khur ni lci ba rnam bor nas //
translated: Having cast off the heavy load,

original: gzhan dag blang bar mi bya'o //🔽sred pa thams cad rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: gzhan dag blang bar mi bya'o // sred pa thams cad rnam spangs shing //
translated: one should not take up another.🔽Having abandoned all craving

original: 'dus byas thams cad zad nas ni //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad zad nas ni //
translated: and exhausted all conditioned things,

original: dngos po thams cad yongs shes na //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs shes na //
translated: having fully understood all things,

original: slar yang srid par mi 'ong ngo //
analyzed: slar yang srid par mi 'ong ngo //
translated: one will not return to existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku nyams su bstar ba las skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad pa na de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku nyams su bstar ba las skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad pa na de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul lo //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, having attained the bliss of liberation, remained in the same cross-legged posture for seven days, without anyone offering him alms.

original: de'i tshe tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po gnyis shing rta lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig dong ba na lam de nyid du zhugs par gyur to //🔽de nas tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po'i sngon gyi grogs po dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / mdza' bshes su gyur @82a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po gnyis shing rta lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig dong ba na lam de nyid du zhugs par gyur to // de nas tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po'i sngon gyi grogs po dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / mdza' bshes su gyur @82a *//
translated: At that time, the merchants Trapusa and Bhallika, together with about five hundred carts, were traveling on that very road.

original: pa'i lha zhig yod pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: pa'i lha zhig yod pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then a god who had been a friend, minister, relative, and intimate acquaintance of the merchants Trapusa and Bhallika thought this:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na chu klung nee ranydza n'a'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku nyams su bstar nas skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad pa na de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul gyi de la tshong pa ga gon dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na chu klung nee ranydza n'a'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku nyams su bstar nas skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad pa na de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul gyi de la tshong pa ga gon dang /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in the Nyagrodha forest on the banks of the Nairañjanā River, under a bodhi tree. Not long after his full enlightenment, he was experiencing the bliss of liberation, savoring the bliss of his body. He had spent seven days in a single cross-legged posture. No one had offered him alms, so the merchants Tapussa and🔽

original: bzang po gnyis kyis der thog mar bsod snyoms 'bul du bcug na /
analyzed: bzang po gnyis kyis der thog mar bsod snyoms 'bul du bcug na /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, not long after his full awakening, was staying in the Nyagrodha Park in the village of Urubilvā, sitting in meditation for seven days in the bliss and joy of liberation. No one had offered him alms, so he thought, “If I allow the merchants Tapussa and Bhallika to offer me alms here,

original: de ni tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po de gnyis kyi yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po de gnyis kyi yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: that will be for the long-term benefit, welfare, and happiness of the merchants Tapussa and Bhallika.

original: ma la bdag rang gis /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma la bdag rang gis / 'di lta ste /
translated: So I will myself🔽make an effort

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bsod snyoms 'bul du gzhug pa'i phyir brtson par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: to allow the Blessed One to receive alms.”

analyzed: de na lha des shing rta dang / tshong pa thams cad snang ba rgya chen pos gsal bar byas nas tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The god illuminated the entire chariot and the merchants with a vast light and said this to the merchants Anāthapiṇḍada and Bhadra:

original: tshong pa / tshong pa dag /
analyzed: tshong pa / tshong pa dag /
translated: “Merchants, merchants!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di lteng rgyas na chu klung nee ranydza n'a'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku snyams su bstar ba na skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di lteng rgyas na chu klung nee ranydza n'a'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku snyams su bstar ba na skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed Buddha is staying in the hot springs region, at the foot of a bodhi tree on the banks of the Nairañjanā River. Not long after his full awakening, he is resting in the bliss of liberation, sitting cross-legged for seven days.

original: de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul gyi /
analyzed: de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul gyi /
translated: No one has offered him alms.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: these are the four noble truths.

original: bzhi gang zhe na; sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na; sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: What are the four? They are the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the arising of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /🔽skye ba sdug bsngal dang / rga ba sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal @96a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na / skye ba sdug bsngal dang / rga ba sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal @96a *//
translated: What is the noble truth of suffering?

original: ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de'ang sdug bsngal ba dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de'ang sdug bsngal ba dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: It is birth which is suffering, old age which is suffering, disease which is suffering, death which is suffering, sorrow and lamentation, pain, sadness and distress are suffering, not to obtain what one wants is suffering; in short, the five aggregates affected by clinging are suffering.

original: de yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to fully understand this, one should cultivate the noble eightfold path.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na; yang srid pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang de la mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na; yang srid pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang de la mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: “What is the noble truth of the arising of suffering? It is craving for renewed existence, which is accompanied by the passion for enjoyment and is delighted and attached to this or that.🔽It is to be cultivated in order to abandon it.

original: de spang ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o; ;sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i ba den pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o; ;sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i ba den pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering?

original: yang srid pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang / de la mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de nyid ma lus par spangs pa dang / bor ba dang / bsal ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: yang srid pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang / de la mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de nyid ma lus par spangs pa dang / bor ba dang / bsal ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: It is the complete abandonment, giving up, renunciation, release, and cessation of that craving for renewed existence, which is accompanied by the passion for enjoyment and is delighted and attached to this or that.

original: 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nub pa ste de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nub pa ste de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: It is to be cultivated in order to realize it.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: the noble eightfold path,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag @96b pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag @96b pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de yang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de yang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and right concentration.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na tshe dang ldan pa kun shes koondi n+ya len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na tshe dang ldan pa kun shes koondi n+ya len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When this Dharma discourse was taught, the Venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya’s mind was liberated from the contaminations without further appropriation.

original: lnga sde'i dge slong lhag ma rnams la ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so; ;de'i tshe 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa gcig dang / gnyis pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: lnga sde'i dge slong lhag ma rnams la ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so; ;de'i tshe 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa gcig dang / gnyis pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The remaining four of the group of five monks gave rise to the dust-free, stainless Dharma eye that sees phenomena. At that time, there was one arhat in the world, and the second was the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dge slong lnga sde'i lhag ma rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dge slong lnga sde'i lhag ma rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the remaining five monks:

original: dge slong dag ;gzugs ni bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag ;gzugs ni bdag ma yin no //
translated: “Monks, form is not the self.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: gal te gzugs bdag yin na gzugs la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur zhing /🔽gzugs la bdag gi gzugs 'di lta bur gyur cig /
analyzed: gal te gzugs bdag yin na gzugs la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur zhing / gzugs la bdag gi gzugs 'di lta bur gyur cig /
translated: if form were the self, form would not lead to affliction and suffering,

original: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam na yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam na yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and one could say of form, ‘Let my form be like this, let my form not be like this.’

original: dge slong dag /🔽gang gi phyir gzugs bdag ma yin pa de'i phyir gzugs la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing gzugs la bdag gi gzugs 'di lta bu 'gyur cig /
analyzed: dge slong dag / gang gi phyir gzugs bdag ma yin pa de'i phyir gzugs la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing gzugs la bdag gi gzugs 'di lta bu 'gyur cig /
translated: Monks,

original: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam pa yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam pa yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because form is not the self, form leads to affliction and suffering, and one cannot say of form, ‘Let my form be like this, let my form not be like this.’

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni bdag ma yin no //
translated: feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not the self.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: gal te rnam par shes pa bdag yin na rnam par shes pa la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur zhing @97a *//
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa bdag yin na rnam par shes pa la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur zhing @97a *//
translated: If consciousness were the self, consciousness would not be subject to injury or pain.

original: rnam par shes pa la bdag gi rnam par shes pa 'di lta bur gyur cig /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bdag gi rnam par shes pa 'di lta bur gyur cig /
translated: And one could say, ‘May my consciousness be like this,

original: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam na yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam na yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: may it not be like that.’

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: But, monks,

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing rnam par shes pa la bdag gi rnam par shes pa 'di lta bur gyur cig /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa la gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing rnam par shes pa la bdag gi rnam par shes pa 'di lta bur gyur cig /
translated: since consciousness is not the self, consciousness is subject to injury and pain, and one cannot say, ‘May my consciousness be like this,

original: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam na yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig snyam na yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: may it not be like that.’

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: ji snyam du sems /🔽gzugs rtag gam /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems / gzugs rtag gam /
translated: what do you think?

original: mi rtag / btsun pa /
analyzed: mi rtag / btsun pa /
translated: Is form permanent or impermanent?”

original: mi rtag lags so //
analyzed: mi rtag lags so //
translated: “Impermanent, Lord.”

original: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal yin nam /🔽sdug bsngal ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal yin nam / sdug bsngal ma yin /
translated: “Is what is impermanent suffering or happiness?”

original: btsun pa / sdug bsngal ba lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa / sdug bsngal ba lags so //
translated: “Suffering, Lord.”🔽“Is what is impermanent, suffering, and by nature changeable fit to be regarded thus:🔽‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”

original: mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa de la cig 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa de la 'di ni bdag go /
analyzed: mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa de la cig 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa de la 'di ni bdag go /

original: bdag ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di yin no //
translated: ‘This is my self.

original: 'di ni bdag gi bdag go zhes bdag tu khas len tam /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag go zhes bdag tu khas len tam /
translated: This is my self that is mine.’

original: btsun pa / ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa / ma lags so //
translated: ” “No, Venerable.”

original: dge slong dag ;ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ;ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, monks?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag gam mi rtag /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag gam mi rtag /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness permanent or impermanent?”

original: btsun pa / mi rtag lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa / mi rtag lags so //
translated: “Venerable, they are impermanent.”

original: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal yin nam /🔽sdug bsngal ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal yin nam / sdug bsngal ma yin /
translated: “Is what is impermanent suffering or happiness?”

original: btsun pa / sdug bsngal lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa / sdug bsngal lags so //
translated: “Suffering, Venerable.”

original: mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa de la gcig 'phags pa @97b nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ni bdag go /🔽bdag ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa sdug bsngal ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa de la gcig 'phags pa @97b nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ni bdag go / bdag ni 'di yin no //
translated: “Is it that the noble disciple who has heard much would assert a self in relation to what is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change?🔽‘This is my self.🔽This is my self that is mine.’

original: 'di ni bdag gi bdag go zhes bdag tu khas len tam /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bdag go zhes bdag tu khas len tam /
translated: Or do you accept a self that is the self of that?

original: btsun pa / ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa / ma lags so //
translated: “No, Venerable One.”

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs gang yin pa de ci yang rung ba 'das pa'am /

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: the future,

original: da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'am /
translated: or the present,

original: nang gi'am; phyi'i'am /🔽rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: nang gi'am; phyi'i'am / rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
translated: whether it is internal or external,🔽gross or subtle,

original: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
analyzed: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
translated: inferior or excellent,

original: gang dag thag ring ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag thag ring ba'am /
translated: far or near—

original: gang dag thag nye ba de dag thams cad ni bdag ma yin /
analyzed: gang dag thag nye ba de dag thams cad ni bdag ma yin /
translated: all of that is not the self,

original: bdag ni de ma yin /
analyzed: bdag ni de ma yin /
translated: the self does not have that,

original: de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag ba'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag ba'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: and that is not the self of the self.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,🔽therefore, whatever there is of feeling,

original: de lta bas na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa gang ci'ang rung ba 'das pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa gang ci'ang rung ba 'das pa'am /
translated: perception, volitional factors, and consciousness—whether it is in the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: the future,

original: da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'am /
translated: or the present,

original: nang gi'am / phyi'i'am /🔽rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: nang gi'am / phyi'i'am / rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
translated: whether it is internal or external,🔽gross or subtle,

original: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
analyzed: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
translated: inferior or excellent,

original: gang dag thag ring ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag thag ring ba'am /
translated: far or near—

original: gang dag thag nye ba de dag thams cad ni bdag ma yin /
analyzed: gang dag thag nye ba de dag thams cad ni bdag ma yin /
translated: Those that are close are not the self.

original: bdag ni de ma yin /
analyzed: bdag ni de ma yin /
translated: The self is not in them.🔽The self does not possess them.

original: de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, you should see them with correct wisdom.

original: dge slong dag /🔽'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di bdag ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag / 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di bdag ma yin /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: bdag gi ma yin par lta ste /
analyzed: bdag gi ma yin par lta ste /
translated: in this way, the noble disciple who has learning sees that the five appropriating aggregates are not the self and are not the self’s.

original: de de ltar lta ba na /
analyzed: de de ltar lta ba na /
translated: When he sees in this way,
