analyzed: 'jig rten ci'ang len pa med @98a *//
translated: he does not take up anything in the world.

original: do; ;len pa med pa na yongs su gdung ba med do //
analyzed: do; ;len pa med pa na yongs su gdung ba med do //
translated: When he does not take up anything, he does not get burned.

original: yongs su gdung ba med na bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med na bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: When he does not get burned, he himself attains nirvana, thinking, ‘My births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la bsten to //
translated: I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will know no other existence than this one.’

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na lnga sde'i dge slong lhag ma rnams kyis len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na lnga sde'i dge slong lhag ma rnams kyis len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When this Dharma discourse was taught, the remaining five monks’ minds were liberated from defilements without further grasping.

original: de'i tshe dgra bcom pa lnga dang / drug pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dgra bcom pa lnga dang / drug pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: At that time, there were five arhats, and the Blessed One was the sixth.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das w'a ra n'a si'i 'bab chu gnod pa can gyi 'gram na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das w'a ra n'a si'i 'bab chu gnod pa can gyi 'gram na bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One stayed at the bank of the Nairañjanā River in Vārāṇasī.

original: de'i tshe w'a ra n'a si na rigs kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba'i bu grags pa zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe w'a ra n'a si na rigs kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba'i bu grags pa zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
translated: At that time, there was a man named Yaśas, the son of a leading family in Vārāṇasī.

original: de nyi ma re re zhing bud med kyis byas pa'i rol mos rtse bar byed /
analyzed: de nyi ma re re zhing bud med kyis byas pa'i rol mos rtse bar byed /
translated: Every day he would play with the music of women,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed pas lus snyoms /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed pas lus snyoms /
translated: and because of his sexual activity, his body became tired,

original: lus dub / lus rgud pas myur du gnyid log par gyur to //
analyzed: lus dub / lus rgud pas myur du gnyid log par gyur to //
translated: and because his body was tired, he quickly fell asleep.

original: bud med de rnams kyang lus snyoms /
analyzed: bud med de rnams kyang lus snyoms /
translated: Those women also, because their bodies were tired,

original: lus dub / lus rgud pas gnyid log par gyur to //
analyzed: lus dub / lus rgud pas gnyid log par gyur to //
translated: and because their bodies were exhausted, fell asleep.

original: rigs kyi gtso bo'i bu grags pa mtshan mo gnyid sad pa na bud med de dag thams cad brdol zhing sgron mor byung la skra zhig /
analyzed: rigs kyi gtso bo'i bu grags pa mtshan mo gnyid sad pa na bud med de dag thams cad brdol zhing sgron mor byung la skra zhig /
translated: When Yaśoda, the son of the guild master, awoke from sleep at night, he saw that all those women had burst open, become lamps, and their hair was disheveled.

original: lag pa brkyang ste byung rgyal du bla ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: lag pa brkyang ste byung rgyal du bla ba mthong ngo //
translated: He saw them stretching out their hands and babbling wildly.

original: mthong nas kyang de dag gi chung ma la dur khrod kyi 'du shes skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang de dag gi chung ma la dur khrod kyi 'du shes skyes par gyur to //
translated: Having seen that, he developed the perception of a charnel ground toward his wives.

original: de nas rigs kyi gtso bo'i bu grags pa mal chen po la babs te /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi gtso bo'i bu grags pa mal chen po la babs te /
translated: Then Yaśoda, the son of the guild master, got down from his large bed,

original: rin @98b po che'i lha ma brgya stong ri ba zung gcig gyon nas nyal khang gi sgo ga na ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: rin @98b po che'i lha ma brgya stong ri ba zung gcig gyon nas nyal khang gi sgo ga na ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: put on a pair of garments worth a hundred thousand precious jewels, and went to the door of the bedroom. Having arrived,

original: grogs po / bdag ni gtses so //
analyzed: grogs po / bdag ni gtses so //
translated: he cried out in a loud voice, “Friend, I am being oppressed!

original: grogs po / bdag ni nyams so zhes skad ngan phyung ba dang / de'i sgo mi ma yin pa rnams kyis phye nas skad kyang mi grag par byas so //
analyzed: grogs po / bdag ni nyams so zhes skad ngan phyung ba dang / de'i sgo mi ma yin pa rnams kyis phye nas skad kyang mi grag par byas so //
translated: Friend, I am being destroyed!” The non-human beings opened the door for him and made his voice inaudible.

translated: He bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.🔽When the Blessed One had instructed, encouraged, inspired, and delighted the group of good men from the Ūrmaṇa village with a discourse on the Dharma, they rose from their seats, draped their upper robes over one shoulder, made the gesture of supplication to the Blessed One, and said to him, “May the Blessed One assent to our offer of a meal at our houses tomorrow together with the community of monks.”🔽The Blessed One assented to the group of good men from the Ūrmaṇa village by remaining silent.🔽Then the group of good men from the Ūrmaṇa village, understanding that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated him three times, and left.🔽Then the Blessed One, not long after the group of good men from the Ūrmaṇa village had left, entered the state of composure that is a buddha’s form of the absorption that is a lion’s无所发🔽 Translation: Having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, they sat to one side.

May we receive the full ordination in the Dharma and Vinaya! May we practice the holy life in the Blessed One’s presence!”🔽The Blessed One said, “Come, monks! Practice the holy life to bring an end to suffering!”

analyzed: mngon par 'phags so //

analyzed: bdag cag dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol /

translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: de nas grong ba'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te /

analyzed: mngon par dad nas skyabs su song ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du gong ma bzhin no //

analyzed: de nas grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs mas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the young women Nandabalā and Nandabalā’s mother requested the Blessed One,

analyzed: btsun pa / de'i slad du 'dir zhal zas kyi mdzad pa mdzad du gsol /
translated: “Lord, please take your meal here together with the community of monks.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the young women Nandabalā and Nandabalā’s mother by his silence.

analyzed: rnam grangs du mar gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang / bca' ba dag rang gi @109b lag nas bstabs shing tshim par byas so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol zin te phyag bcabs shing lhung bzed gyur bar rig nas stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khod do //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis grong pa'i bu mo dga' mo dang / dga' stobs ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with a talk on the Dharma, instructed, inspired, encouraged, and delighted Nanda and Nandabalā.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /

analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
translated: and after rising from his seat, he departed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong khyer sde can nas gshegs pa na 'di snyam du dgongs te /🔽ngas yul ma ga dha 'dir ngang tshul bzang por bkur ba'i dge sbyong ngam /
